meanings.definition: The act of wearing away or grinding down by friction.
meanings.sent1: The detrition of the old wooden floor was evident from the scratches and marks.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the detrition caused by the constant rubbing of the stone against the metal resulted in a smooth surface.
meanings.sent3: The detrition of the pencil eraser made it look like a tiny mouse had been nibbling on it.
meanings.sent4: The detrition of the relationship between the two friends slowly eroded their trust and bond.
meanings.sent5: The detrition of the glacier against the mountain created a breathtaking valley over centuries.

meanings.definition: The process of gradual wearing down or weakening.
meanings.sent1: The detrition of the fabric was visible in the form of thinning areas and frayed edges.
meanings.sent2: The detrition of the team's morale was noticeable as they faced continuous losses.
meanings.sent3: The detrition of the rubber band made it lose its elasticity, causing it to snap unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The detrition of the paint on the old house revealed layers of different colors underneath.
meanings.sent5: The detrition of the rock formation by the ocean waves sculpted intricate patterns in the stone.
